Ask HN: How to scan a lot of photos in 2022
text:
My mother passed a few years ago and I've been holding onto dozens of large family photo albums. There are probably 10,000s of photos from about a 20 year time span.

I would like to digitize. The local places I've contacted that provide this service are either too expensive or not a place I could trust. So I think I am going to DIY.

Hoping someone can give tips on hardware or software that could make this easier. Large flatbed scanner + the right software that can parse, separate, store multiple images at once? Has anyone done a large undertaking like that that can provide some guidance?

We built a Rotten Tomatoes-style platform for products
text:
About 1.5 years ago, I introduced my review aggregator BuyForLife on Hacker News, where it became the #8 most upvoted Show HN project of all time. The idea of helping people to make better purchasing decisions continued to chase me over the last year. Here are some stats that illustrate how important online reviews are:

• 90% check online reviews as part of their online buying journey

• 43% visit 5-10 websites to research a product

• 75% spend more than a day doing research before buying a product

The top frustrations with the current process are:

• Google full of SEO spam and Ads

• Fake reviews

• Fragmented trusted sources

• Inconsistent information across sources

Thanks to the recent advances in NLP (transformers, GPT-3, etc.) it became possible to solve these problems at scale, so I decided to team up with my co-founders Johnny and Tavis to build https://Looria.com.

We aggregate and summarize the most trusted product reviews on the web. Just like Rotten Tomatoes provides trustworthy ratings for movies, Looria offers ratings and reviews for all kinds of products. Our vision is to make Looria the go-to platform for making purchase decisions.

Ask HN: Do you prefer to see the instructor when watching or course or not?
text:
Hey all,

I'm planning to make a small course on building products with Django and before I begin I want to see if people really want to see the instructor. If not, there would be no reason to play around with video, background and all this stuff and focus on the content and audio.

Feel free to reply here, or on the Twitter Poll I created:

https://twitter.com/builtwithdjango/status/1550129914149421056

Ask HN: Is there any way to fix the new Google Analytics UI?
text:
It looks like Google has rolled out a very anti-user update to Analytics.

We have a report on traffic by URL broken out by query string that we use weekly. Right now that report is unusable, and if I try and query I can only query by page title, not URL and definitely not query string.

Is there a way to revert this update, or tell Google "I know what a URL is, please stop this."
